item.title: Introduction
item.description: Welcome to the course on writing dialogue. If you’ve read my other writing courses, you know I’d normally start by explaining I teach a little differently (in a practical, more useful way) and then a chapter defining what exactly I mean with Plot, or Character, or whatever.

item.title: Punctuation
item.description: This chapter is a short overview of the general rules for actually writing dialogue on the page. With dialogue, you need to consider two steps.

item.title: The Why of Dialogue
item.description: As always, I want to start with why. Why do we put dialogue in our stories? Why would you add it?

item.title: The Interesting Conversation
item.description: Alright, so you have decided to tell a part of your story through dialogue. What to do now? How do we make the dialogue as interesting and natural as possible?

item.title: The Human Filter
item.description: Last chapter already mentioned how good dialogue is an automatic consequence of having good characters. This chapter drills down on that idea and gives more specific tips for how to use this.

item.title: Natural Language
item.description: The previous chapters explained how to set yourself up for an interesting dialogue scene. One that deepens characters by having them talk in a way that matches their view of the world.

item.title: Rhythm & Flow
item.description: All chapters until now have talked about what to put in your dialogue (or what to leave out). It’s about the (general) content of the dialogue.

item.title: Subtext I
item.description: I’ve mentioned the mistake of making dialogue too “literal” and “complete” several times during this course. This chapter puts that idea on steroids.

item.title: Subtext II
item.description: This is the second part of the chapters about subtext. If you haven’t read the previous one, please do so first, as this one directly continues on the same ideas.

item.title: Tips & Tricks
item.description: Welcome to the final chapter of this course! There were a handful of tips or mistakes that didn’t fit anywhere else (or that I wanted to repeat) again, and that’s what this chapter will cover.
